meanings.definition: To depend.
examples: Why do we rely on animals when we test our products for safety?

images.alt: Photo of a group ready to catch a person.
images.description: A group of cheer leaders stand, gathered in a circle, ready to catch another, single, cheerleader who is high up in the air.
images.caption: The cheer leader in the air relies on her team mates to catch her.

meanings.definition: To respond.
examples: If animal testing is designed to protect humans, then why do so many people react negatively to it?

images.alt: Photo of a soccer goalie stopping a ball.
images.description: A soccer goalie is on the ground, arms fully extended, holding a soccer ball.
images.caption: Quick reaction time enabled this soccer goalie to stop the ball.

meanings.definition: Other, different.
examples: Companies that use alternative methods of testing products advertise to people who avoid products tested on animals.

images.alt: Drawing of four types of transportation.
images.description: A drawing showing four types of transportation, including airplane, ship, train, and car.
images.caption: Instead of driving, alternative ways to travel include trains, airplanes, and sometimes even boats.

meanings.definition: To show or prove to be right; to defend.
examples: Some people argue that helping humans does not justify animal testing.

meanings.definition: An organized way of doing something.
examples: His method of working has been successful for him.

meanings.definition: Likely, in the future, but not yet.
examples: I am potentially going on a trip next month.

meanings.definition: An organized investigation in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions.
examples: We are fighting meningitis by raising money for medical research.

meanings.definition: to try to find.
examples: The dog was seeking the bone that he had left in the yard.

images.alt: Photo of a dog with its head close to the ground.
images.description: A dog walking near a fence. The dog's head is close to the ground.
images.caption: The dog keeps its head close to the ground so that it can use its sense of smell to find things.

meanings.definition: To make progress, build, make stronger.
examples: The protests advanced the pressure on the government to bring about reform.

images.description: A group of people holding signs about protecting the Earth and the environment.
images.caption: Marching and respectfully explaining your position are great ways to help causes you believe in.

source.title: Earth Day March in NYC 2017
source.author: Terry Ballard from Merrick, New York, USA

meanings.definition: Fraction; compared amounts; amount as compared to a whole.
examples: Only a small proportion of medical researchers inflict pain or harm on animals.

images.description: A pie chart graphic with percentages labeled for each of four sections.
images.caption: Each section of the pie chart represents a different proportion of the whole.
